events.originalText: In Baltimore, Maryland, U.S., Freddie Gray died of injuries sustained a week earlier while in the custody of the Baltimore Police Department.
events.subtitle: Baltimore
events.headline: Freddie Gray dies in Baltimore police custody

events.originalText: A truck bomb destroyed much of the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, killing 168 people and injuring more than 680 others.
events.subtitle: Car bomb
events.headline: Truck bomb kills 168 in Oklahoma City

events.originalText: A gun turret on board the United States Navy battleship Iowa exploded, killing 47 sailors.
events.subtitle: Gun turret
events.headline: 47 sailors killed in explosion on USS Iowa

events.originalText: "Advance Australia Fair", written by Scottish-born composer Peter Dodds McCormick, officially replaced "God Save the Queen" as Australia's national anthem.
events.subtitle: Advance Australia Fair
events.headline: Australia adopts new national anthem

events.originalText: The first space station, Salyut 1, was launched from the Baikonur Cosmodrome near Tyuratam, Kazakh SSR, USSR.
events.subtitle: Space station
events.headline: Salyut 1 launched as first space station

events.originalText: The Doors' L.A. Woman was released, their final album during Jim Morrison's lifetime.
events.subtitle: The Doors
events.headline: The Doors release final album with Jim Morrison

events.originalText: American actress Grace Kelly (pictured) became the princess consort of Monaco upon her marriage to Rainier III, Prince of Monaco.
events.subtitle: Grace Kelly
events.headline: Grace Kelly becomes princess consort of Monaco

events.originalText: American actress Mae West (pictured) was sentenced to ten days in jail for "corrupting the morals of youth" for her play Sex.
events.subtitle: Mae West
events.headline: Mae West sentenced to jail for play 'Sex'

events.originalText: Anti-Jewish riots broke out in Kishinev, the capital of Bessarabia Governorate, causing the death of nearly 50 Jews and focusing worldwide attention on the persecution of Jews in Russia.
events.subtitle: Kishinev pogrom
events.headline: Anti-Jewish riots in Kishinev lead to deaths

events.originalText: War of the Fifth Coalition: French general Louis-Nicolas Davout defeated an Austrian force in  Lower Bavaria, allowing him to rejoin the main French army.
events.subtitle: War of the Fifth Coalition
events.headline: French general Davout defeats Austrian force

events.originalText: The States General of the Dutch Republic received John Adams, and the house he had purchased in The Hague became the first United States embassy.
events.subtitle: States General of the Netherlands
events.headline: John Adams received by Dutch States General

events.originalText: The American Revolutionary War began with the Battles of Lexington and Concord in the British colony of Massachusetts.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: American Revolutionary War begins in Massachusetts

events.originalText: The Polish Partition Sejm met to discuss the First Partition of Poland, carried out the previous year by Russia, Prussia and Austria.
events.subtitle: Partition Sejm
events.headline: Polish Partition Sejm discusses First Partition

events.originalText: With no living male heirs, Charles VI, Holy Roman Emperor, issued the Pragmatic Sanction, allowing the Habsburg hereditary possessions to be inherited by a daughter.
events.subtitle: Charles VI, Holy Roman Emperor
events.headline: Pragmatic Sanction allows Habsburg inheritance by daughter

events.originalText: In Lisbon, a crowd began a massacre of Jews who had been forced to convert to Christianity.
events.subtitle: Lisbon massacre
events.headline: Massacre of Jews in Lisbon by forced converts
